comment.body: .bat file for windows should work fine.

> [erkan](#comment_16_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): just verifying with the 2nd tester, one moment please

"9 hours ago" Are u ok pal? Long moment if you ask me =D

May be I'm a slowpoke? But I don't get it. Why is this better than zeroID?

> [erkan](#comment_19_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @eventi I can see all 15 comments here (also checked with a proxy). The person who also commented was @kaffie
> @musickiller yeah it was a long night. It's not better than zeroid, it's just a clone. I added in the why?-section above why I made it. Someone also said: "id for irl friends, id for university, id for internet chan". As long as people don't misuse this for spam and such: it's ok.

then it only makes sence to use a single auth system, with different names for friends, uni, chan etc. I have nothing against a name like uni.mk, chan.mk, etc. But I won't like if someone will write with my name. Bad news - it IS going to happen sooner or later.

So may be SITES should notify if id manager is different? Like when someone is writing from "sk@wrong.bit", Mail would tell me "attention! this ID is not present on your "known" list!" or "this id's verification service is not ZeroID!"

I think it smells of monopolization, but still a good option. One still may ignore it and use whatever he likes (in case his name was taken on other ID server for example), but the majority (wich may be not as geeky of current majority) will stay safe.

What'chu think?

A great idea. But I think I'm too lazt to do the same for my blog xD
Nut some day I'll do this too!
Agreed and reposted to my blog. People should know who is behind all this cool stuff))

Deleting your folder is not nessesary. You can just edit a .json file and delete some of your comments/ chat posts. Half will do fine, I guess.

But I think there is some bug in there, because I have a constant trouble with my blog.
http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.musickiller.bit/?Post:50:A+bug+with+comments+limit
May be I'm just doing it wrong?))

is there a bitmessage for android?
could you please also give a link to how it works?

> [erkan](#comment_30_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): For Android there's BitSeal (1), last commit 7 months ago. I didn't try myself, though. 

thx

> "How it works": you mean, how I would send the message in bitmessage? Sure, I can add some screenshots also.
> (1) https://github.com/JonathanCoe/bitseal

ahahah) no!) I mean where are messages stored, accounts, other stuff... tech stuff. I can't just install an app I don't understand at all)
*of course if you know that. I can use google myself when I get home)

> [erkan](#comment_30_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf):
> (1) https://github.com/JonathanCoe/bitseal

to make refs you should use [reference] [1]
[ 1] : reference

with no spaces

* it does not seem to be working with coments

as far as i understand, it does not record ip

> [musickiller](#comment_8_15NScazvsCHNmiXi6o6nvaMiwjeJYizgZQ): ahahah) no!) I mean where are messages stored, accounts, other stuff... tech stuff. I can't just install an app I don't understand at all)*of course if you know that. I can use google myself when I get home)

Was child porn not enough for them?
It's good that my blog address starts with CIA, not NSA. Conspiration is everything!

> [erkan](#comment_41_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @musickiller you should be especially careful, your name contains K I L L E R

there is still a lot of music in it. as I said, my conspiration is inpenetrable!

exactly what I was writing about [here](http://127.0.0.1:43110/blog.musickiller.bit/?Post:48:DO+YOU+WANNA+LIVE+FOREVER+!!!)
... actually I was writing about it every time I reached 10k limit (I was chatty in comments...), but the solution is only in the last post.

poor nofish... When I was asking him, he was answering in a way as if I was #100 who asked him.

> [erkan](#comment_62_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @musickiller Foolish me, I must somehow missed this :-( 
> Our both reason for this (hitting the max limit) is certainly a very disturbing thing.It felt like this for me:ZeroNet is made for new users, but punishes those who love and use it (the "oldtimers").

I think, oldtimers are supposed to know stuff =D
Anyway, ZN is still fresh, many things will change yet, obviously. Like the mail. The last update changed it good.

And imagine how I laughed when I've discovered that the old mail was not deleted but hidden! (I've reached the limit a couple of days before the update.)
I was saying "Erkan was right after all! Deleting the old mail was a good idea!" =D

> [erkan](#comment_64_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): We're the twister gang :-)And I am pretty sure, when the microblog app comes for ZN: we can bring over quite a bunch more people

So we could become the Twister Mafia! ^_^

> [basxto](#comment_4_1PVcdu7USZH2kHMETbqDYLPjJZKCDWM52k): @musickiller: Well I know one thing from diaspora*, as an ‘oldtimer’ you are more likely to overlook new features, since you already have your established workflow. (even there I feel pretty new, it's running since '10 and I'm there since '11)

I have not said neither that we are some oldtimers, nor that this app was created not a long time ago. I said that features pressnted here are fesh and still need polishing. However that's also a good news. I'm not a necromancer (even though my blog is 3 times undead) to use some ancient apps, new stuff is cool.

> [erkan](#comment_63_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): Now we both are "oldtimers" :-) I still remember how I made you and @ks laugh... :-)

But the phrase reminds me of "Starship Troopers" (have you took it from there? I have not watched it then and also for a long time before then, so I can mistake here), where it was said from one young man to another after smth. like ... 4 drops? And due to war time realities, a lower in rang was aleady a sergeant. In the "S.S. Invaskon", Ricko was a general while not being so much older.

Considering how fast ZeroNet changes this days, "now we both are oldtimers" is a good reference, I guess)

// sorry for a long comment on a short phrase, but it's saturday and I'm in university, on a stupid lab-work, and the man thinks we're his lab-rats. bitch... I hate him.
Read about the Stagefright bug. Interesting and important. Will post that one in my blog.
Duh... I miss retweets sometimes...

> [pzmw](#comment_1_1ALXyaQsvvCQ3R5WBrPbe4dXsqnLCLEkB7): Do you mean that it's centralized because it's a single site or is there some server-client thing going on as well?

coz @nofish owns it and if someone sizes his PC he can just delete it.

by providing additional mailing system, Erkan provides you with some decentralization.

> [ax](#comment_1_1LnYjFf7ZGJGmyUhd6pyG5GQYDrPBNVkCX): Hands up, who's cloned ZeroMail? I have.
> What happens if erkan's puter is stolen?

the same stuff =) The idea here is that if there is a lot of such sites, someone like FBI can't kill all of them. Problem here is that it's annoying when one guy has zeromail, the other zeroverse, next one has his own clone and so on... I did not said I like this idea =))))))

But I don't see anyone done anything better, so why not to try mail@zeroverse)

//afk, and I don't think I'll come on this page again. so u don't have to answer me)))
oh, wait, also zeroverse uses bitmessage to make users. Wich is better. (more secure?) And ZeroMail does not support zeroverse accounts. So mail@zeroverse has some improvement over ZeroMail. =D
it's the one that is distributed from the site, as far as I remember. I'm not sure about bundle, but zeronet-master is 915, if I'm not mistaken.

yea! play! that's right. My local package version was 915, so I made a stupid assumption that's it's still the one that's online.

I came when ppl posted about play on Twister too. Came to be disappointed in Play and discover the whole ZeroNet.

> [erkan](#comment_99_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): It's good that you stayed and didn't leave again!

again? what do you mean?

> the diff-feature will only work if 80% of the site's clients are updated to the rev1200 version

Ugh.. What exactly does it mean? There is no way site can log such stuff, so I guess the correct phrase would be "if 80% of site's visible peers are updated.

Is this right?

is it possible to see this info somewhere? (site's peers, and if the diff-feature is on)

> [erkan](#comment_120_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): yes

OK thanks

> If you want to test the feature itself, you can create a simple site and 2 people subscribe, then it's 100% of peers already...

yea, I thought about it, but it sounds unnecessary. I think I'm a patient person, I can wait.

what about ZN installers being awailable from ZN? One would be able to use a gateway to access it, and I can't think of a more secure location =)

ok, I could not think of a more secure location mainly because I was not thinking. Any torrent would do. And you would only need to share magnet links. Anywhere!

How's that as an idea?)

> [erkan](#comment_124_1H8oKiRa7fGgUqS1hpUtaSYLvAqkaknbkf): @musickiller
> 
> see "Distributing on torrent probably would cause other problems,since it's blocked on many networks even outside of China"
> gateways/proxies: yes, if we can trust the proxy operator. But that problem exists everywhere. We"d need to provide also a strong hash/gpg checksum on the file(s) itself.

how can one block torrents? o_O Stupid Russian politicians block torrent sites too, but it's not a problem for Tor..

And I speak of DHT, not trackers!

You can place it into a torrent network and share magnets or torrent files with Zeronet gateways! (that's what I said in my previous comment actually, guess it was not obvious)

//Yes, I still wanna call it gateways, not proxies...

> [nofish](#comment_6_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): There is many ways to do this: packet inspection/udp restrict/port whitelist/router.bittorrent.com (central DHT server for most of torrent clients)  connectionBlocking a standard, https connection is much harder, than detecting a P2P one. 
> If someone wants to block Tor, then its also easy, since all Tor node ip is public: https://torstatus.blutmagie.de/

I thought, ZeroNet is also p2p o_O

> [nofish](#comment_7_1J3rJ8ecnwH2EPYa6MrgZttBNc61ACFiCj): it's also possible to detect zeronet p2p traffic, but since it's a new and not well known protocol probably you can still use zeronet on networks where bittorrent is blocked.

NO-no. my point is that if someone will try to block torrents, they will block ZN too. So why not to deliver it with torrents? If someone can't download torrents, they most surely won't be able to use ZNet (as you said, sooner or later that will be so).

There is nothing bad with my idea of delivering ZN with P2P connection after all ^_^

But yea, that should be one of several options. I never meant to say "use only torrents"..

Benchmarks SUCK! My phone works just as fast as my PC when the initial download is finished, but benchmark there takes 100 times longer! (May be 50....)

BM does not show anything really important! It's just a way to say "hey, my machine is faaaster!", it does not mean that ZN will work faster!
nice)

Erkan, KS, my favourite ZN bloggers, why are you silent? CIA finally got you and as I write, are crushing your fingers in order to get your private key and capture all ZeroNet?

I miss you guys!))
still in progress?
